meanings.definition: The bottom or base of a hollow organ or cavity.
meanings.sent1: The doctor examined the fundus of the stomach during the surgery.
meanings.sent2: The water collected at the fundus of the well.
meanings.sent3: The fundus of the vase seemed to hide a secret treasure.
meanings.sent4: Her smile reached the fundus of his heart, warming him inside out.
meanings.sent5: The darkness at the fundus of the cave made it hard to see anything.

meanings.definition: The part of a hollow organ that is farthest from its opening.
meanings.sent1: The flashlight illuminated the fundus of the tunnel.
meanings.sent2: The fundus of the balloon was filled with helium.
meanings.sent3: He joked that the fundus of the sock must be where missing socks go.
meanings.sent4: The fundus of the river seemed to stretch endlessly into the horizon.
meanings.sent5: The treasure map led them to the fundus of the old well.

meanings.definition: The part of the eye opposite the pupil.
meanings.sent1: The ophthalmologist examined the fundus of the patient's eye.
meanings.sent2: The light reflected off the fundus of her eye, revealing a reddish hue.
meanings.sent3: She joked that the fundus of the eye must be where dreams are stored.
meanings.sent4: The beauty of the sunset reflected in the fundus of his eyes.
meanings.sent5: The intricate details of the fundus of the eye amazed the medical students.
